column5: That Iâ€™m a socially awkward loser who lost all of his potential. My dreams were crushed once I learned the truth. Hell I feel alone all of the time. Nothing works. No joy no drive. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™m crazy or mental-for example earlier I heard a convo between two coworkers and all they said was, â€œHEY HOW ARE YOU?â€ â€œGOOD N YOU?â€ â€œGOODâ€ â€œTHATS NICEâ€ â€œTHE WEATHERâ€

Hereâ€™s one thing no one will tell you: Who gives a shit? Iâ€™m depressed as hell, suicidal and Iâ€™ve been self destructive for so long that Iâ€™m just tired af. I give up trying to feel wanted-fuck it if my dog wants me then Iâ€™m ok. I know Iâ€™m the shit, even if the world doesnâ€™t. Iâ€™ve done things that are unique to myself and I know my worth. Everyone around me just has an idea of me but no one knows the story from start to finish. I know the random times Iâ€™ve missed my bus and Iâ€™ve been left stranded, or when I got the phone call my dad died, or when I had to figure out how I was going to get home after waking up in a hospital, or when I saw my ex hated me and I couldnâ€™t get her back or when I sat outside by the harbor the first time I figured out how to sneak out of my house. Only me. Just me. Fuck everyone else. I can love but Iâ€™m done trying to make my life into this pretty picture. Itâ€™s not. I heard somewhere that American culture is all about overhyping things than they really are. Trust me, the movies and tv shows are all imaginary. Thereâ€™s some truth but youâ€™ll never see the ugly parts, where the character smells his own farts or picks his nose or when he lashes out in private into the unknown or the moments where you sit by the harbor inches from the dark waters. Live for yourself and if anyone joins, all the better. Fuck society, I AM the center of the universe. I am better therefore I should bless the world with my amazing self. It sounds selfish, but Iâ€™ve been selfless for so fucking long. Iâ€™m not going to hide and pretend that Iâ€™m some perfect saint. Build the few connections you have and learn how to be thankful-at least itâ€™s not the Middle Ages or prehistoric times or an African/Jewish slave that doesnâ€™t even have a name or comprehension of the entire universe.
Iâ€™m among the living dead. But I am not alive.
But my mind knows when Iâ€™m lying. I know when Iâ€™m just fooling myself.
Thatâ€™s the problem. I donâ€™t know what I want. I did at one point but then I had to grow up.

Pretty much. Itâ€™s all downhill from here. That and you start to connect with people less and less. Maybe, statistically speaking, itâ€™s our fate. Itâ€™s all a bell curve-a wave. The majority are â€œhappyâ€ and the extremes are too depressed or too happy without worry. I think Iâ€™m on the far end of depression. Hopefully 2029 is the year it all ends.
